column1: The Purple Pig////Their menu is tapas style
column2: so we ordered the Pork Jowl ($18).  Surprisingly
column3: it was more like an open faced bacon-lettuce-tomato (BLT) sandwich
column4: topped with an over easy duck egg.  The bread was also really firm.  Everything was just so extreme
column5: flavorwise.  I was barely recovering from the sourness and hardness of the bread that when I reached the stuffed squid ($18)
column6: my lips and tongue were numb.  Overall
column7: their food seems to be on the sour end
column8: at least from my experience.  This is a pretty well-sought out restaurant in Chicago
column9: but perhaps it just wasn't for me.
